attributes.action: Suspend Mortgage payments for COVID-19 in the UK
attributes.additional_details: Many people will not be able to manage mortgage payments due to low self employment income, low paid employment income and sickness payment if the UK is to go in to lock down and people need to self contain, there will be many people with no reserves to maintain their mortgage and usual bills. It seems a reasonable and fair to follow in the footsteps of Spain and do so as it is the governments responsibility to retain Pandemic in the first place.
attributes.background: Suspend Mortgage payments for self containment and if national lock down over COVID-19 occurs in the UK from day one until normal daily life is back in order.

rejection.details:
Suspending payments for mortgage payments is a matter for individual mortgage providers, and not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling for the Government to introduce a Universal Basic Income to give people home and food security during the coronavirus outbreak: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302284

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
